metadata.title: CVE-2020-15025 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: ntpd in ntp 4.2.8 before 4.2.8p15 and 4.3.x before 4.3.101 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by sendingpackets, because memory is not freed in situations where a CMAC key is usedand associated with a CMAC algorithm in the ntp.keys file.

criterions.comment: ntp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
